text: Eugene Francis "Gene" Fama (; born February 14, 1939) is an American economist. He is best known for his empirical work on portfolio theory, asset pricing, and the efficient-market hypothesis. He is Robert R. McCormick Distinguished Service Professor of Finance at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. In 2013, he shared the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences jointly with Robert J. Shiller and Lars Peter Hansen.The Prize in Economic Sciences 2013 , nobelprize.org, retrieved 14 October 2013 ==References== Category:1939 births Category:Living people Category:American economists Category:Scientists from Boston Category:Writers from Boston
title: Eugene Fama
